fields.description:
See resolution of Support Request with Nicholas

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-10538

While the RSS feeds do reach the DAO caching layer and the database is minimally impacted, the CPU utilization of the VM is huge - directly proportional to the "items" parameter of the feed request.

I think the workaround is to install one's own caching at a front controller HTTP like Squid and/or to filter GET requests and limit the size of the items value.

I think that product team needs to solve this caching matter in the product - at least for anonymous GET requests it should be very easy to add this to the existing caching infrastructure.  I think that the Admin Console and Confluence configuration needs to have an optional maximum items parameter so that the CPU load can be somewhat insulated.
fields.summary: Feed service is not caching leading to heavy CPU load

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9332]. {panel} I have created a user macro which mimics the regular confluence loginform on a normal page (I needed this to allow login via a space which is using Adaptavist Theme builder). It is a simply copy of the html login form + a parameter to the return page when logged in: {code}

Enter your account details below to login to the A-Server Customer Portal.

Username:

Password:

Forgot password?

{code} usage: {code}{loginform:returnpage}{code} I also copied the css to theme builder custom css. The form works perfectly fine unless I type a wrong password. When this happens I get a *HTTP Status 405 - HTTP method POST is not supported by this URL* (from Apache Tomcat/5.5.15) Is there a way to evade this problem and send the user to a page which shows the loginform again and tells the user that he entered a wrong password? Or could this loginform macro be added as a new feature with some more possibilities, like a parameter were you can tell the form where to go when something went wrong? thx
fields.summary: Custom login form
Confluence uses incorrect DOCTYPE

fields.description:
Currently the Server ID is buried inside the URL in the Confluence setup wizard. 

We will need to also display the Server ID in plain text in case the user does not click on the link to generate a license (eg, they dont have direct internet access) but would need to copy and paste the server id into the website.

Please see screenshot on example of this in JIRA's setup wizard.

Chris told me to schedule this task for 2.6.1.

Let me know if you have any Qs. Thanks!
fields.summary: Display the Server ID string in the Setup Wizard

fields.description:
When editing a page, the newly added content will be duplicated when the "Save" button is clicked twice.
Steps to reproduce:

# Edit an existing page
# Paste/add a fairly long content onto the page (say about 10 lines of content)
# Click the "Save" button twice
# The page is seen to have duplicate content of what have been edited 

This is reproducible in both "Rich Text" and "Wiki Markup" editor.
fields.summary: Duplicate content when "Save" button is being clicked twice during page editing
when you copy a page, all images are set to 'width=32,height=32'

fields.description: If would be handy if the new code macro can support syntax highlighting of C++ code.
fields.summary: Code macro: Syntax-highlight C++ code

fields.description:
During some builds getting a lot of these errors in the logs:

Caused by: net.sf.hibernate.ObjectDeletedException: The object with that id was deleted: 66718, of class: com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.SpaceDescription
fields.summary: Lots of ObjectDeletedException's during cluster builds

fields.description:
Since fixing CONF-3507, customers are meant to be able to run DB2 with a transaction isolation level of "read committed" (2 in JDBC speak, "cursor stability" in DB2). However, in Confluence 2.5.6, that level causes deadlocks.  Customers must again set their transaction isolation level to "read uncommitted" (1 in JDBC).

The setting can be made by adding the following line to confluence.cfg.xml:

<property name="hibernate.connection.isolation">1</property>
fields.summary: DB2 can deadlock with Transaction Isolation Level of read committed
"Since you last logged in" list of users contains duplicates

fields.description:
I have a fairly large Word document attached to a confluence page.

My confluence pages are intended to provide information that is supplementary to the Word doc, so each confluence paragraph typically needs to refer to specific sections within the Word document.  The document is updated regularly and so the section numbers are fairly volatile.

Ideally I would like to put links in my confluence page that cause the attached Word document to open at the relevant section.

Using the normal hyperlink notation of  filename.ext#bookmark
Where bookmark is a named bookmark in the Word document doesn't appear to work

Thanks for helping - this is really important to us!
fields.summary: Linking to a MSWord bookmark in an attached MSWord document results in broken link

fields.description:
- creating a page with a specific space, specific parentid, but a blank title succeeds, even if a page with a 'blank' title already exists.
- this creates pages that are visible as 'children' of the specified page, but have no title and cannot be accessed from the web interface
fields.summary: storePage succeeds in adding multiple pages with an empty string as a title, which can then not be accessed from the user Interface

fields.description: I have a user on OS X 10.4 running firefox.  When she tries to edit a page, the rich text edit area is small (and it seems to have problems initializing since there's an <H2> in there) and none of the tabs work, so she can't switch to wiki markup.
fields.summary: RichText Editor is very small

fields.description:
I have a user which is complaining of the following sequence happening to her.  She is running Safari 2.0 on OS X 10.4.

Here's the steps she's doing:

* Open an existing page 
* Hit the edit tab
* The title will either be set to blank, or it may have the existing title in it.
* make changes and hit save (including re-entering the title, if it was blank)
* the title is erased and the "You must enter a title" message appears
fields.summary: User asked to enter title when editing page

fields.description:
If you have configured the Confluence URL as http://confluence.yourdomain.com, but access it as https://confluence.yourdomain.com then the {livesearch} macro does not display live search results (clicking on ok works though).

FireFox displays the error message "Fehler: uncaught exception: Die Erlaubnis für den Aufruf der Methode XMLHttpRequest.open wurde verweigert" which is something like "uncaught exception: it is not permitted to execute XMLHttpRequest.open". This error message is generated whenever the xml request url does not match the actual website url. 

It works correct when accessed as http://... or when the Confluence domain is set to https://...

The fix would be to modify this request so that the request actually matches the current access method.
fields.summary: {livesearch} macro does not work with https

fields.description: If I go to edit a page on a site that requires CAPTCHA response to commit the changes, I am still requires to enter the CAPTCHA phrase if I cancel the edit.  This can be seen on any Atlassian Confluence page.  Expected behaviour is to return to the normal view of the page directly.
fields.summary: Cancel edit still requires CAPTCHA response

fields.description:
When a RSS feed is created through Feed Builder with following attribute :

# Types of content: Pages , Comment
# Labelled with at least one of the labels:labelname 

If a page with label=labelname, when a comment is added to it, the filter doesn't pick up the comment because the COMMENT doesn't have the label on it. If label restriction is taken off , all comments & all pages are shown in the feed.
fields.summary: RSS feeds that filter on labels should include comments of pages that match the label

fields.description:
When modifying the {{ConfluenceActionSupport.properties}} on-the-fly causes 
{quote}
Unable to bootstrap application: Exception bootstrapping cluster:Failed to get build number from cluster.
{quote}

Seems to only be related to 'clustered' version - was not able to replicate his problem on a standalone version.

Further, while debugging this:

- When modifying the confluence-init.properties file while the application is running causes the app to bring an empty page, does not kill the server though. Should we provide some form of locking to prevent modifications to _critical_ application's files such as this one? confluence-cfg.xml etc...
fields.summary: Editing ConfluenceActionSupport.properties causes cluster shutdown

fields.description:
- security vulnerability found in Confluence 2.5.6

Space administrator can use the "Import Pages from Disk" feature to browse the server file system by pointing the importer at "/" folder (or any other folder). Because this folder doesn't contain expected files, an error message is displayed, disclosing information about the underlying file system that an average user should never have access to.

The following error(s) occurred:

    * An error occurred importing: /dev. Consult console log file for error details.
    * An error occurred importing: /etc. Consult console log file for error details.
    * An error occurred importing: /lib. Consult console log file for error details.
    * An error occurred importing: /usr. Consult console log file for error details.
    * An error occurred importing: /bin. Consult console log file for error details.
    * An error occurred importing: /var. Consult console log file for error details.
    * An error occurred importing: /sbin. Consult console log file for error details.
    * An error occurred importing: /opt. Consult console log file for error details.
    * An error occurred importing: /tmp. Consult console log file for error details.
    * An error occurred importing: /proc. Consult console log file for error details.

This information is very valuable for experienced malicious users and can be used for subsequent attacks at the server.

Attacker might not stop only at browsing through the file system, but (s)he can also get access to the files that the user used to run the java container has access to.

If system is not configure properly attacker can import into Confluence files like /etc/passwd and other files containing critical information related to the web server and the network.

Even if the system is properly configured, if attacker points the importer at ConfluenceHome dir, (s)he'll get access to confluence.cfg.xml, which contains JDBC configuration details, possibly including the database location and password. User can also gain access to files belonging to other users, temporarily stored in the ConfluenceHome/temp folder.

In addition to this, under certain conditions it might be possible to cause a DoS or DDoS attack at the server by pointing the importer at folders with large text files (e.g. log files).
fields.summary: Unwanted Access to File System via Import Pages Functionality

1. osuser2atluser.jsp: invalid import of org.hsqldb.Row

2. User "confluence@earthuser.org" is already in the OSUser DB

fields.description:
Currently, the following steps need to be performed _after_ mvn idea:idea -Pfunctional-tests to get the dev environment to the point where you can run functional test:

* Add src/etc to the confluence-rpcclient source path
* Add src/test/etc to the classpath of the confluence module
* Add the confluence-acceptance-test module to the classpath of the confluence module (creating a circular dependency)
* Add src/test/acceptance to the source-path of the confluence module

When doing something that involves dependencies, you have to do the edit pom/rebuild idea/run acceptance tests cycle frequently, and having to do these manual steps over and over again is a significant waste of time.
fields.summary: IDEA dev environment build needs improvement

fields.description:
CONF-8855 was meant to prevent error messages from hibernate when trying to add a page with a title > 255 characters in length.

Unfortunately, in DB2 *queries* (as opposed to inserts) with too large a value for the field still fail.  The validation code still does a check for existing pages, even after the length check fails. This means we still get a stacktrace (attached).
fields.summary: Setting a page title to be too long gets stack trace in DB2

fields.description: It's old and, as far as I can tell, no longer maintained. We should use commons fileupload instead.
fields.summary: File-uploading improvement: Remove dependency on pell-multipart library

fields.description: Since we have moved Confluence 2.5.x to use the latest atlassian-user where the hibernate repo is no wired up with caching managers, we need to make sure we set the flag cache="true" explicitly in atlassian-user.xml (and make that the shipped default).
fields.summary: Caching is not enabled by default for the hibernate repository
Blog-Post macro parameter 'match-labels=all' incorrect if a label does not exist

fields.description:
In an attempt to get named parameters out of user macros, tried:

{my-macro:defaultParam|heresParam1=param1Value|heresParam2=param2Value}

just to try getting $param1 = "heresParam1=param1Value".

Both $param1 & $param2 end up being empty.  If an equal sign is anywhere in the param string, the parameter does not get defined.

If you remove the "=" sign from the contents of either and replace it with pretty much anything, $param1 and $param2 end up defined properly.
fields.summary: if equal sign ("=") included in a user macro parameter, that entire parameter is ignored
DynamicTaskList should word-wrap the task text to multiple lines

fields.description:
The "tiny link" for email feature built into confluence is *super* useful, thank you for it.  Unfortunately, it is now generating links like:

http://wiki.mydomain.com/x/_4M-

Paste that link into outlook and it will fail to auto-link the hyphen, linking just:

http://wiki.mydomain.com/x/_4M

Which doesn't work.  Supremely non-useful.  I wrote a script to create and delete a page automatically, as confluence appears to be cycling through values, but I've gone through hundreds and I'm not past the hyphens yet.
fields.summary: Tiny Link can generate URLs ending with punctuations (which outlook doesn't like)
Confluence should be able to automatically recover from cluster panics

I found a very nice photo album script named zenphoto (http://www.zenphoto.org/) and I was wondering if it was possible to create a plugin for confluence (I know you have to gallery plugin but the fancy one doesn't work in IE and the standard one is plain boring). The script is php and ajax based but maybe this can be solved by using the php/java bridge (http://php-java-bridge.sourceforge.net/pjb/)

Maybe someone can look into this.

thx
fields.summary: Zenphoto plugin instead of gallery plugin

fields.description: Currently, when a page is renamed, instances of the {include} and {excerpt-include} which reference that page become broken.
fields.summary: when a page is renamed, find and update instances of the {include} and {excerpt-include}
Cant Release Bundled Plugins Before Releasing Confluence

fields.description: Hosted would like the ability to plug in new wiki renderers via a Confluence plugin.  Ideally, a system similar to web fragments would be used so that a plugin could provide a wiki renderer and a weight, which determines where in the renderer will be injected into the existing chain.  Basically, we're asking for wikiFiltersSubsystemContext.xml, specifically the registration of v2Components, to be pluggable.  If this isn't implemented, Hosted can keep patching Confluence, but by implementing it, it will not only make our lives easier, but allow us to widely distribute our link renderers that allow Jira tickets, Fisheye commits, and Fisheye source files to be automatically linked.
fields.summary: Pluggable wiki renderers

fields.description:
The use of the HTTP {{cache-control: no-store}} header causes browsers such as Mozilla and Firefox to re-fetch the page when using browser history navigation facilities such as the back button. This also causes the annoying "Do you want to repost this page" type requests when browsers must resubmit a form post to fetch the page.

We should eliminate the use of this header for all resources except where absolutely appropriate.
fields.summary: Improve browser-caching and back-navigation by removing the "no-store" cache control headers

fields.description:
Resources served from the /display/ URL path are not sent with headers to prevent caching.

It would seem from the {{ConfluenceEncodingFilter}} that resources in this path are meant to be served as non-cacheable resources however the predicate has been written incorrectly:
{{uri.indexOf("/display/") > 0}} instead of {{uri.indexOf("/display/") >= 0}}

This will fail when confluence is deployed in the root context path.
fields.summary: Resources served from /display/* are not sent with correct cache headers

fields.description: Provide specifications for CONF-2524 : Page namespacing
fields.summary: Specification for page namespacing support

fields.description: Provide specifications for CONF-1031 : Page ordering

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9285].
  {panel}

Instead of simply blasting out the last 15 news posts when visiting the news tab of browse space, we should present a better summary of news activity in the space. Ideas include:

* A more concise summary of recently posted news
* A summary of recent comments against news in the space
* Displaying popular labels in the space
fields.summary: Improvements to the News tab in 'Browse space'
Display user avatars in recent changes section of page info tab

fields.description:
The FourOhFour action does not have access to the current user.

This was found when trying to implement CONF-9194.

For some reason the action that processes the 404 results does not have access to the currently logged in user.  We suspect its because the request is not going through the correct filter chain and the thread local is not being set.
fields.summary: 404 Action doesn't get User Information

fields.description:
Following the instructions on [Developing Confluence Plugins with Maven 2|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Developing+Confluence+Plugins+with+Maven+2], I created a new plugin project. Here is a summary of the steps taken:

* cd myworkspace
* mvn archetype:create -DarchetypeGroupId=com.atlassian.maven.archetypes -DarchetypeArtifactId=atlassian-plugin-archetype -DarchetypeVersion=2.3 -DremoteRepositories=http://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/contrib/repository/maven2 -DgroupId=com.g2microsystems.confluence.plugins -DartifactId=g2-plugin -Dversion=0.1 -DpackageName=com.g2microsystems.confluence.plugins
* \# edit pom.xml just to fill in the TODO bits
* mvn eclipse:eclipse

However, doing so, an eclipse project is created, but importing it into eclipse reveals it as *not* a Java project. I believe this to be because no .classpath is generated by the goal.

However, if I change the following lines in pom.xml:

    <groupId>com.g2microsystems.confluence.plugins</groupId>
    <artifactId>g2-plugin</artifactId>
    <packaging>atlassian-plugin</packaging>

to:

    <groupId>com.g2microsystems.confluence.plugins</groupId>
    <artifactId>jar</artifactId>
    <packaging>atlassian-plugin</packaging>

then the eclipse:eclipse goal does the right thing. I think it should be doing the right thing for atlassian-plugin.
fields.summary: pdk not generating java (w. .classpath file) project on eclipse:eclipse goal

fields.description:
Have a plugin with I18n properties file
{code}
<atlassian-plugin>
  ...
     <resource type="i18n" name="i18n" location="myproperties" />
</atlassian-plugin>
{code}

{{myproperties.properties}} is included in the plugin's jar.

Installed in *Node 2*, everything works well, UK looks nice with the properties loaded, NP

View page in *Node 1* and I get the string Key :-(
fields.summary: Plugin's I18n properties not loaded in other cluster nodes unless restarted

Enable private uploads and private child-creation to a public page (a.k.a Drop Box)

fields.description:
When using two massive nodes behind a load balancer with session affinity by IP, if you login and then go to the URL where the hostname is the hostname of one of the nodes, the login state is lost (it thinks you are logged out). So simulaneously the same user can be hitting the cluster via the load balanced hostname in one window of firefox, and in another window be not logged in in another window of firefox on the same box. This state can be maintained also (one firefox window can be adding anonymous comments, while the other window is editing pages in the same cluster as a logged-in user). To recreate this you may have to hit one of the nodes directly and click login (I forget if I did that or just went to the load balanced hostname).

This seems like a bug, but maybe it is just a byproduct of the way that firefox does things. Anyway- thought I'd let you know in case it helps.
fields.summary: Current user logged-in/auth'd is lost in massive if you switch hostnames

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9275].
  {panel}

I'd really like to be able to get information about who logged in from which IP address.  I'm not too worried about user interface, I just want to get at the underlying information.  The most obvious place to look for this was alongside the last login date, but it appears that the information isn't recorded there (this is querying our PostgreSQL database):

{noformat}
confluence=# select entity_key from os_propertyentry where entity_name='OSUser_user' group by entity_key order by entity_key;
                  entity_key
-----------------------------------------------
 confluence.prefs.email.mimetype
 confluence.prefs.notify.for.my.own.actions

fields.description:
We're using a ProxyPass to front-end our confluence instance running on a tomcat on port 8070/8079/8075.  The configuration looks like this:

<VirtualHost *:80>
  ServerName wiki
  RewriteEngine on
  RewriteRule ^/$ http://wiki.dlib.indiana.edu/confluence/ [R]
  ProxyPass /confluence/ ajp://feta.dlib.indiana.edu:8079/confluence/
  ProxyPassReverse /confluence/ ajp://feta.dlib.indiana.edu:8079/confluence/
</VirtualHost>
<VirtualHost *:80>
  ServerName bugs
  RewriteEngine on
  RewriteRule ^/$ http://bugs.dlib.indiana.edu/jira/ [R]
  ProxyPass /jira/ ajp://feta.dlib.indiana.edu:8079/jira/
  ProxyPassReverse /jira/ ajp://feta.dlib.indiana.edu:8079/jira/
</VirtualHost>

When grabbing large attachments, the output is truncated.  However, I've verified the filesize in the data directory and I can retrieve the files whole when not going through the proxy.  Is there a setting I'm missing?
fields.summary: Attachments Truncated when using Apache/ProxyPass

fields.description:
when having wiki code inside a code macro like 
\{code}
\h1. this
blabla
\h2. that
blabla
\{code}

and page uses \{toc} or \{toc-zone} the headlines are rendered inside the toc list too
fields.summary: headlines (h1, h2,..) included inside code macro are rendered from toc and toc-zone macro

fields.description:
It would be great if  user or administrator can restrict or configure number of page-history.
i.e. store for the last 2 weeks, store for the last 30 histories..


Page-history is a so great feature.
But confluence has all histories, it would cause a performance problems with our server, we think.
(maybe, it would be one of reasons that It takes a long time to display pages with a lot of histories.)
fields.summary: [Request]　new feature:Restrict number of page-history

fields.description: Using both TOC plugin and {{expand macro}} will not hotlink to the header/content (hidden) within the {{expand macro}} via TOC. This is otherwise when the header within the macro is expanded (unhidden). Hence, there is a need to support the hotlink to the content may it be hidden or unhidden.
fields.summary: {toc} problem, Included content is indexed and shows up in the TOC but selecting the some TOC entry doesn't take you to the content.

fields.description:
When navigating to an invalid webwork action URL you will be presented with an exception error report and not the friendly 404 error page.

confluence 2.5.6 produces correct 404 error pages:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/foo.html - correct 404 page
http://confluence.atlassian.com/foo.action - correct 404 page

confluence extranet_2.6_20070820:
http://extranet.atlassian.com/foo.html - picked up by 404 error page correctly (although see: CONF-9194)
http://extranet.atlassian.com/foo.action - exception error page
fields.summary: Invalid webwork action produces exception in Tomcat

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9269].
  {panel}

There are getting to be more and more ways to create and edit pages in Confluence using third party plugins, WEBDAV, imports, as well as the builtin RTF and wiki markup modes.  Recently WordDAV was added to the mix.  Each method has its merits and drawbacks as well as ideosyncracies, so they don't play well together in the same page under many circumstances.   Just switching back between RTF and wiki markup modes has been known to cause havoc.

I suggest what I hope to be a minor improvement that enables users who create pages more control over which method can be used to edit a page in order to avoid conflicts between editing techniques, causing reformatting errors,  wiki markup ceasing to function, or markup being inadvertently removed from the page.  It could be especially helpful to novices in certain environments

For RTF vs wiki markup, a user could set a new property of the page being edited that future edits would have to be done only with a particular method RTF or Wiki Markup.  The creator (and revisor ?) could also prohibit the remote API from updating a give page.  (The property would also prevent switching between editing modes.)  For 3rd party plugins, it probably becomes more difficult without the plugin author cooperating to implement a new feature, but the idea is the same.  For pages that are generated or edited through the remote API from such software as the Word AddIn, there would need to be a way for detecting (and setting ?) what was permissible.

An administrative enhancement might even allow global and space administrators to set a property that determines which method(s) are permitted by default.

This improvement could potentially mitigate many problems users are having by enabling them to work around issues instead of Atlassian trying to identify and fix many open issues that are currently in this Editing issue section one by one.
fields.summary: Enable users  who create pages more control over which editing method can be used to edit a page to prevent editor conflicts.  Administrators can also determine permissible editing modes globally and per space.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9268].
  {panel}

The search capability of Confluence is starting to fall behind that offered by many commercial knowledge products.  In particular there is no ability in Confluence to specify synonym rings (a ring is a set of terms which have equivalent meaning - a term meaning a word or a phrase).  This is useful for many reasons in particular knowledge domains (for example a user could enter either an acronym or its equivalent long form or other predefined synonym into the search box and the indexed Content Entity Objects would return documents that contain any of them).  Also there is no ability to predetermine that certain Content Entity Objects  are always matched to particular search terms in order to guarantee that desired content is returned if someone uses a particular search term.  There are no extensions employed by Confluence to allow search to provide faceted search capabilities (for example, see [http://drupal.org/project/faceted_search] or SOLR )

These features are important to enhancing the functionality of knowledgebases and providing users with more fine tuned search capability that, if used skillfully, are more likely to produce useful and quick access to content for the average non-technical user without having to be a search query guru.

These features should be implemented in search in such a way that they can be configured per space or globally and that plugins such as metadata and advanced search can take advantage of the added features, being able to extend or modify their behavior for particular purposes.

Finally, there should be the option to index rendered wiki pages such that wiki markup is never shown to the user in search results.

Make custom metadata (ala metadata plugin) capability and metadata reporting/searching an integrated part of the base Confluence product

Incorporate these features into the Remote SOAP interface.

The features should be configurable primarily by either site and/or space administrators depending on scope.

Some of these features have various open source implementations that are demonstrated or have become commercial products.  Products such as Sharepoint 2007 and others have implemented some of these features or are rumored to be adding them in the near future.

Note: I was reminded that this is probably too broad for a feature request.  I apologize for that.  I just wanted to tie a lot of related aspects of the search improvements I was requesting together (as a wish list).
fields.summary: Extend Lucene search engine in Confluence to add support for synonym rings, faceted search, etc
Scrollable Tables with Fixed Header

fields.description: in PDF the body of the code macro is ignored
fields.summary: code Macro not supported in PDF Export

fields.description:
This is an intermittent problem. 

A page contains several versions of an attachment uploaded by different authors. Occasionally, when:  

a) a new comment is added to the attachment
b) a new version of the attachment is uploaded
c) when the attachment is moved 

*ALL* historical versions have their last modifier changed to user who was behind one of the above. The last modification date is also changed to the latest update. 

This is a problem because you lost track of who made changes to the attachment. This is really important to some organisations.
fields.summary: Attachment history gets lost

fields.description:
When using the rich text Editor on IE 6 SP2, boxes appear after bulleted points. To replicate, view the sample demonstration page in edit mode in IE 6:

/display/ds/Confluence+Overview
fields.summary: Edit mode in IE 6 adds boxes to bullet points

fields.description:
Per page restrictions should be as flexible as space permissions.  Restricting to a single group is too limiting.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Per Page Restrictions Should Be As Flexible As Space Permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9262].
  {panel}

Atlassian plugin files are allowed to specify a minVersion and a maxVersion. These allow the plugin to specify which versions of the product is should work on. However, none of our products actually do anything with this data, so most plugin authors just ignore it.

However, after disucssion with Jeff, we came to the conclusion that we should start respecting the minVersion attribute, and not enable a plugin that violates this constraint. This will help cut down on support cases where people try to install a plugin known not to work.

We also decided NOT to do the same thing for maxVersion, as it would make upgrades much less smooth, *forcing* all plugins to be upgraded for a new Confluence version, even if they did need to be.

The basic behaviour should be that when we attempt to load a plugin, we check for the config attribute, and if we violate the constraint, we return an error message to the user.
fields.summary: Make Confluence respect the minVersion in atlassian-plugin.xml

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm using Confluence with the Firefox 2.0.0.6.
I'm using an external user management.

On the space permission page I noticed a strange behaviour, not only  today, but also several times before.

The situation: 
I have a  wiki space and look at the Space Admin/Permissions page.
Two groups and two individual users are listed on this page. They all have some permissions.
In the Anonymous access section, the view permission is given to anonymous users (green check mark icon under "View").

What I do:
I click the  "Edit permissions" button in the Individual users section.
I enter the user id of a user and click the "Add" button.
The desired user name appears in the list of the individual users and I assign the necessary permissions to him.
Finally, I click the "Save all" button.

The problem:
The view permission in the anonymous access section has gone. The green icon with the check mark has changed to a red one with a cross.
All other permissions are set as desired.

Maybe you can reproduce this problem.

Kind regads, 
Stefan Prange
fields.summary: View permission for anonymous users disappears after adding or removing an individual user on space permission page

fields.description: It's possible for Confluence to crash if it runs out of memory. Memory can get low due to a leak in a plugin, or due to an automatic backup of a very large database, for example. If Confluence can detect a low memory situation, that would allow an administrator to take appropriate action before a crash occurs. It would also alert the administrator to the fact that there may be another problem which is causing this situation to occur.
fields.summary: Confluence should warn when memory is low

fields.description:
Hello,

We noticed incorrect behavior in how Confluence searches for single-bye and double-byte Japanese strings. Search for roman alphabets yields results incorporating both single and double-byte matches, as it should be. Similar behavior is required when searching for Japanese characters, for example, search for single byte katakana or numeric characters should return results matching both single and double byte occurrences, but now only double-byte matches are being retrieved. Please see attached Excel sheets summarizing the {color:red}current behavior{color} and the {color:green}required behavior{color} for [single-byte|^Character requirement (single).xls] and [double-byte|^Character requirement (double).xls] Japanese strings. Could you please investigate this and incorporate this improvement in a future release?

Thanks,

Neeraj
fields.summary: Incorrect search results for single and double-byte Japanese strings

fields.description:
It is not possible to change permissions for the owner of a personal space. No error is thrown, the changes just are not made. If another administrator is specified there should be no reason why the permissions cannot be changed.

The above two points are the reason why I have logged this as a bug report rather than a feature request - the functionality is there, it just isn't working for personal spaces as it does for global spaces.

This should be resolved to cater for the following scenarios amongst others:
* Administrators could use personal spaces to track information about a user but not want that user to have access to it (for example HR could keep an electronic employee file, etc)
* You might want to allow users control over most content/etc but be able to restrict certain portions of their personal space (for example making the Home page read-only and using it to track user details, etc)
fields.summary: Administrators cannot modify permissions for a personal space's owner
Include server ID in server info page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9255].
  {panel}

An RSS icon could be added to the following pages to provide a method of notification to administrators:
* Administration > Manage Users (showing all additions/removals/disables as well as changes to full names or e-mail addresses)
* Administration > Manage Groups (showing all add/remove operators as well as changes to membership)
* Administration > Global Permissions (showing all changes)
* Space Admin > Permissions (showing all changes)
fields.summary: Add an RSS feed & link for certain user & permissions management pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9254].
  {panel}

It would be great to be able to define username and full name blacklists via the Administration console. This would especially be great for Confluence installations with public signup enabled. For example, taking Atlassian's own Confluence - there is nothing to prevent users from signing up with a username such as "atlassian", or "atlassian.sales", or "atlassian.staff", etc (not to mention rude words). Similarly with full names - there is nothing to prevent a user from changing their name to "Atlassian Staff" and such.

As far as I can tell, the only ways that the problem can currently be avoided for usernames are either disabling public signup, or painstakingly creating users with disallowed usernames (not ideal as they would count toward licenses - also a problem if a 'disallowed' username authors content before it is picked up).

For full names the problem is even worse, as anybody can change their name at any time and there is nothing preventing multiple people from choosing the same name. For example, 20 people could all change their full name to "Atlassian Support" regardless of whether they work at the company or not.

The blacklist should be ignored for administrators, perhaps with a warning/confirmation screen if their choice of username/full name is picked up by the blacklist.
fields.summary: username & full name blacklist

fields.description:
Please find out if SAP Application Server is incompatible with Confluence or compatible but untested - see http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Known+Issues+for+SAP+Application+Server

This server should have its status as unsupported mentioned on the List Of Supported Application Servers at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/List+Of+Supported+Application+Servers with appropriate links.
fields.summary: Document status of SAP Application Server on the list of supported application servers

fields.description:
This is a regression of CONF-7401, caused by the wrong version of Lucene being included in WEB-INF/lib/ (CONF-9249).

The error looks like this:

com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: java.io.FileNotFoundException: .../confluence-home/index/_135.del (Too many open files)

A workaround will be posted once we've determined the definitive list of JARs to remove.
fields.summary: "Too many open files" error during index operations
Add "Browse Space" to the "Page Deleted"-page

fields.description:
Most importantly, we include both a patched and unpatched Lucene Core, which causes file-handle problems in some application servers.

We need to fix this before releasing 2.6, and push a 2.5.7 without duplicates.
fields.summary: Duplicate dependencies in WEB-INF/lib/

fields.description:
Use the "style" parameter while embedding an image in the page. For eg:
{noformat}
!DefaultSpaceContent.png|style="border-width: 1pt; border-color: gray"!
{noformat}
Save this page.
If confluence has been configured to use the "Wiki-Markup" by default, the page opens in the edit mode. Now switch to the "Rich_Text" mode but switching back to the "Wiki-Markup" mode is not possible. If the page opens in the "Rich-Text" mode by default, you cannot switch to the "Wiki-Markup" mode.
If any changes are made to this page in the "Rich-Text" mode and saved, an exception is generated. Please review the attached exception.

This has been reproduced in FireFox.
The error and the problem could not be reproduced in Safari and IE.
fields.summary: "Style" parameter not renderring correctly when switching to wiki-markup mode

fields.description:
using Clickr, when adding a page, if you click on the preview tab the cursor remains on screen. You can then continue to type although you won't see your text until you switch back to the 'Rich text' tab. This problem also exists with the left navigation theme.

This is an IE specific problem.
fields.summary: Switching from Rich Text Editor in clickr theme has glitch

fields.description:
The floating calendar you see on the news posting screen will blank out any posting text that has been typed if it overlaps the text area at all.

This only happens on IE. Assuming the IE Dom Inspector is correct then no style changes occur to the text holding body area within the IFrame. Something else is happening.

A possible approach to this problem could be to swap the current calendar component for the one included with YUI. v2.6 includes the YUI JS libraries and a quick test making a YUI calendar a drag object showed that this worked fine on IE6. (Alternatively, the calendar doesn't really need to be floating at all.)
fields.summary: Floating calendar blanks out posting text

fields.description:
On space/Advanced if you select the 'Space details' option and phantom selection also apears just beneath. The same thing happens on Space/Space Admin with the 'Edit Space Details' selection.

On space/Advanced if you select the 'Export Space' option half a box also appears beneath the 'Subscribe' options.

On space/Advanced selected 'Templates' grows the Export grey box. Clicking on 'Space Details' shrinks it back to it's original size.
fields.summary: Space Admin display glitches with Clickr theme

fields.description: The items in a dynamic task list do not have a 'grab' area on the right hand side in IE. Firefox (win/mac) and Safari both have this useful indicator
fields.summary: dynamic tasklist items are missing grab handles in IE

fields.description: See screen shot from [http://wikis.sun.com/dashboard.action?spacesSelectedTab=new]
fields.summary: New spaces in the dashboard are listed out of order

fields.description:
The HTML Include macro is only documented briefly in a page on enabling it at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Enabling+the+html-include+Macro

The user guide should contain an entry on the HTML Include macro with screenshots. If CONF-6567 has not been resolved, it may also be useful to mention that the macro can only be used for pages with absolute links.

For http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Enabling+the+html-include+Macro the instructions for enabling the macro on version 1.0.3 and earlier should be archived.
fields.summary: Improve documentation on HTML Include Macro

fields.description:
On the 5th reply to a comment, the comment thread is collapsed to the comment and first 3 replies. The reply you have just submitted is hidden from you. 

This isn't ideal - you could be led to believe your comment hasn't been added. And rightly or wrongly people often want to proof read what they have just submitted after submission.

Strangely, this seems to only happen on IE. Couldn't reproduce on Firefox
fields.summary: Comment collapsing or hiding hides comment just added

fields.description:
When adding a comment, the cursor in the rich text editor begins with quite a large indent. When you hit return to move off this line, the indent becomes a 'square' character.

See the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Large initial indent in the rich text editor becomes a square character

fields.description:
When a user doesn't have view permission to view a space, he/she receives 404 page when accessing URLs from this space.

This is a bad UI design. Instead an "Access denied" error should be displayed to communicate clearly what the user needs to do to resolve the problem (request for space permissions).

When a user tries access a page with page level restrictions, and this user is not authorized to view the page, an "Access Denied" error is displayed. This is exactly this same behavior that should be used when user doesn't have space level permissions.
fields.summary: "Page not found" (404) is displayed to users without view permissions, should be "Access denied"

fields.description:
When editing space permissions, the anonymous groups loses view permission under certain circumstances.

Steps to reproduce:
# Go to space permissions view -> Edit
# Add an individual user (A) and assign him/her some permissions
# Make sure that the Anonymous group has the view permission
# Save
# Edit again
# Uncheck all the permissions for user A
# Make sure that Anonymous has the view checkbox checked
# Save

Result:
* User A disappears from the permission tab
* Anonymous group lost the view permission even though the checkbox was check before submit

Expected Result:
* User A disappears from the permission tab
* All the other permissions are set according to the checkboxes in the edit permissions view


This is just one of more vectors that causes the anonymous group to lose view permissions. It happens "randomly" with other editing steps, but this one is easily reproducible.

Justification for the *critical* priority: when this bug occurs, space becomes visible only for registered/privileged users. In some cases it might take days or weeks before someone notices the invalid permissions and corrects them. In the meantime the space is "gone" for the anonymous world.
fields.summary: Annonymous group loses view permission

fields.description:
While investigating an issue with show-to macro, and discovering the content that should've been hidden upon logout, it was possibly diagnosed that the AuthenticatedUserThreadLocal does not clear on Logut Action.

Read http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=19229 for more details.
fields.summary: AuthenticatedUserThreadLocal does not clear on Logut Action

fields.description: See attachment.  The 'server id' is not displayed.
fields.summary: Page render problem on license update screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9235].
  {panel}

The Gliffy Plugin for Confluence stores diagram data as XML Attachments to pages.

If a customer searches for content, and a Gliffy document is a search result, when the user clicks on the search result they get the un-rendered XML of a Gliffy document. 

Ideally, we'd like the customer to be provided a link which points to a page which renders the diagram in a user friendly manner. 

If there was a way to hook into the links that are generated for search results, we could populate that link such that the diagram is rendered correctly for the user.

This is a customer request.
fields.summary: Define custom links for search results

fields.description: The popular-labels macro sorts only by popularity. When using the heatmap option, it is useful to be able to sort alphabetically (that's what most users are accustomed to seeing in a heatmap kind of display). The macro should ofer the option of  option of sorting alphabetically.
fields.summary: Label order in popular-labels macro changes when using a space key parameter

fields.description:
We would like to be able to enforce permissions on personal spaces, so that we can make sure that our customers cannot see our employees personal spaces. 

Furthermore, customers should not be able to view personal spaces belonging to other customers.
fields.summary: Enforced permissions on personal spaces

fields.description:
If you enter an invalid label name (invalid.label) when editing a page, you are correctly returned to the page edit but the label section is hidden.  You can hit submit as many times as you like, you will continue to return to the page edit screen with no error message shown.

If you open the label section you are correctly presented with the error.

This issue was introduced some how during 2.6 development as its not appearing on 2.5.6.
fields.summary: Entering invalid page labels hides label edit section

fields.description:
HTML Entities entered in Wiki Markup are being lost when edited in Rich Text mode. This is breaking other Wiki Markup statements.

(For info on entities, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_XML_and_HTML_character_entity_references)

1) Go to a page, click Edit, click Wiki Markup
2) Enter the following text: {noformat}*one » two » three*{noformat}
3) Click Preview, see the pretty bold words and right angle-quotes
4) Click Wiki Markup, see the same text as in 2
5) Click Preview see the same pretty display as in 3
6) Click Wiki Markup, see the same text as in 2 (again)
7) Click Rich Text, see the pretty bold words and right angle-quotes (again)
8) Click Wiki Markup, see that the Entities are gone, replaced with actual right angle-quotes
9) Click Preview, see that the bold text isn't and that the asterisks are now visible
10) Click Wiki Markup, see the same text as in 8
11) Click Rich Text, see the same text as in 8 (and 10)
12) Click Wiki Markup, see that the asterisks have now been escaped (i.e. "slash-asterisk")
13) Click any tab you like, the text never again changes from this point

The code generated by the entity-less markup displays the actual illegal-in-HTML characters instead of the originally entered legal entities

One note: I just tried the above with the following text: {noformat}*one* *»* *two* *»* *three*{noformat}
The entities still get replaced with right angle-quotes, but the bolding continues to work and the text is unchanged after that. So while this seems to "work" (but creates illegal HTML), that much individual manipulation shouldn't be necessary, should it?
fields.summary: Web entities translated to graphical representation in Rich Text, original entity lost

fields.description:
On Linux, and possibly other Operating Systems, Confluence's index timestamp will silently fail to be updated if it is not the *owner* of the file.  
This seems to be a bug in Java on Linux where the File.setLastModified() method will not update the file even though the user can edit the file without problems.  This means the index itself is successfully updated, but entries effectively never leave the index queue.  Therefore everything gets updated every second run of index flush.

Confluence should at least report an error if the timestamp update files.

The attached diff reports the failure then attempts to remove and recreate the file.  I think that's the most appropriate action.
fields.summary: Incorrect file permissions on index timestamp are not reported

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Attach image to page1
2. Edit page1 and embed the page: !image!
3. Move the image to page2
4. View page1 > Unable to render embedded object: File (harbour.jpg) not found.
fields.summary: Moving an attachment does not update embedded images

fields.description:
Argh! have spent several hours on this one... I hope you guys can shed some light on this one...

Working on a plugin, in a XWork Action. Action is on Page A of Space M

I am traversing Page A's childrens. getting/setting a few content properties ({{contentPropertyManager.get/setTextProperty}}), then create Page B on Space N,This is what I am doing:

{code}
b = new Page();
b.setTitle(source.getTitle());
b.setContent(source.getContent());
b.setSpace(spaceN);
b.setVersionComment(makePublishingComment(approvalCheck));
pageManager.saveContentEntity(b,new DefaultSaveContext());
{code}

And I get the Exception below... Funny thing is that I don't mess with A's children right before, It works...

{code}
2007-08-20 16:52:10,305 ERROR [http-8082-Processor3] [atlassian.xwork.interceptors.XWorkTransactionInterceptor] onThrowable Invoking 
rollback for transaction on action '/plugins/approvalsworkflow/save.action (ApprovalsAction.save())' due to throwable: 
org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateSystemException: a different object with the same identifier value was already associated with
 the session: 17432578, of class: com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.Space; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.NonUniqueObjectException: a
 different object with the same identifier value was already associated with the session: 17432578, of class:
 com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.Space
org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateSystemException: a different object with the same identifier value was already associated with
 the session: 17432578, of class: com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.Space; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.NonUniqueObjectException: a
 different object with the same identifier value was already associated with the session: 17432578, of class:
 com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.Space
net.sf.hibernate.NonUniqueObjectException: a different object with the same identifier value was already associated with the session: 
17432578, of class: com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.Space
        at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.checkUniqueness(SessionImpl.java:1687)
        at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.doUpdateMutable(SessionImpl.java:1453)
        at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.doUpdate(SessionImpl.java:1480)
        at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.saveOrUpdate(SessionImpl.java:1403)
        at net.sf.hibernate.engine.Cascades$4.cascade(Cascades.java:114)

The error is always with that space (id 17432578) that happen to be Space N... Needless to say, I am not modifying Space N at all, just reading it a few statements before adding the page...

{{b}}'s id is zero, as it was just created... thing is why is hibernate getting/assinging that existing id!!?!?!??!?!?!?!??!?!?!?!?!?
fields.summary: NonUniqueObjectException thrown when adding a new page in a plugin

fields.description:
Clicking on the "Configure" link of the "Invite Plugin" throws the attached exception. No "Invite Users" link is present in the Browse Space page. Tested on Confluence v2.5.6.
Could not reproduce in Confluence v2.5.5
fields.summary: Invite plugin throws IncompatibleClassChangeError exception

fields.description:
See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-11004

If name is mixed-case and you do UserAccessor.addGroup(name) followed by UserAccessor.getGroup(name), getGroup(name) must be called with lowercase name for it to return group instance.

In Maven 2 pom.xml:
...
<dependency>
<groupId>atlassian-user</groupId>
<artifactId>atlassian-user</artifactId>
<version>2007-06-19</version>
<scope>provided</scope>
</dependency>
...
<repository>
<snapshots>
<enabled>true</enabled>
</snapshots>
<id>atlassian-m2-repository</id>
<name>Atlassian Maven 2 Repository</name>
<url>http://repository.atlassian.com/maven2</url>
</repository>
...

In code:

import com.atlassian.confluence.user.UserAccessor;

...
String groupName = "MixedCaseGroupName"; // bug only shows up with groupName is mixed-case
...
Group vGroup = userAccessor.addGroup(groupName);
output("group " + groupName + " created);
...
String lowercaseGroupName = groupName.toLowerCase();
if (userAccessor.getGroup(lowercaseGroupName) != null) { output("group " + lowercaseGroupName + " found"); }
else { output("group " + lowercaseGroupName + " NOT found"); }

if (userAccessor.getGroup(groupName) != null) { output("group " + groupName + " found"); }
else { output("group " + groupName + " NOT found"); }
...

This would output:
group MixedCaseGroupName created
group mixedcasegroupname found
group MixedCaseGroupName NOT found
fields.summary: If name is mixed-case and you do UserAccessor.addGroup(name) followed by UserAccessor.getGroup(name), getGroup(name) must be called with lowercase name for it to return group instance
